Social Interaction

Rules for interacting with NPCs and resolving social encounters

NPC Attitudes

NPCs have attitudes toward characters that affect interactions:

AttitudeDescription
FriendlyHelpful and willing to assist
IndifferentNeutral, requires persuasion
HostileUnfriendly, may become violent

Social Interaction Skills

Persuasion

Influence others through tact, respect, and good nature:

  • Convincing someone to help you
  • Negotiating a deal
  • Inspiring a crowd
  • DC based on NPC attitude and request reasonableness

Deception

Hide the truth through misdirection or lies:

  • Telling a convincing lie
  • Disguising your intentions
  • Bluffing in a game
  • Contested by Insight check

Intimidation

Influence through threats or hostile actions:

  • Extracting information through threats
  • Forcing cooperation
  • Bullying someone into compliance
  • Can create lasting resentment

Insight

Determine true intentions of a creature:

  • Detecting lies
  • Reading body language
  • Predicting someone's next move
  • Contested against Deception check

Influence Rules

Changing Attitude

Successful social checks can shift NPC attitude:

  • Friendly to Indifferent: Major offense or betrayal
  • Indifferent to Friendly: DC 15 Persuasion + significant favor or gift
  • Hostile to Indifferent: DC 20 Persuasion + major concession
  • Indifferent to Hostile: Significant insult or threat

Roleplaying Influence

  • Good roleplaying can grant Advantage on checks
  • Poor approach can impose Disadvantage
  • Some NPCs respond better to specific approaches
  • Offering bribes or favors can adjust DC

Requests and Favors

DC for persuading an NPC depends on the request:

  • Trivial favor: DC 0-5
  • Simple request: DC 10
  • Significant favor: DC 15
  • Dangerous or costly: DC 20
  • Against character: DC 25+

Information Gathering

  • Common knowledge: No check required
  • Uncommon information: DC 10 Persuasion or Investigation
  • Rare secrets: DC 15-20, may require multiple checks or sources
  • Forbidden knowledge: DC 25+, NPCs may be unwilling
